bill_title: provide for the issuance of limited use stickers for historical vehicle license plates.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the issuance of limited use stickers for historical vehicle license plates. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-5 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The owner of special license plates for a historical car issued pursuant to § 32-5-77 or a historical motorcycle issued pursuant to § 32-5-77.3 may purchase an annual limited use sticker for the historical plates. A limited use sticker authorizes the vehicle to be driven on public roads for a maximum of two thousand miles per year in addition to the uses authorized in § § 32-5-77 and 32-5-77.3. To purchase the limited use sticker, the owner shall each year present at the office of the county treasurer the current odometer reading of the vehicle, the previous year's odometer reading, and a log of the miles driven during the previous twelve months for purposes allowed under § 32-5-77 or 32-5-77.3. The fee for the limited use sticker is fifteen dollars per year and is in addition to the ten dollars paid for the historical license plates. If the vehicle has exceeded the two thousand miles allowed for the year under the limited use sticker, the fee shall be increased by five cents for each mile that exceeds the two thousand mile limit. Fees collected under this section shall be credited to the state motor vehicle fund. Section 2. That § 32-5-78 be amended to read as follows: 32-5-78. Except as otherwise specifically provided and except as to compensation for use of the highways by motor carriers, the license fees and taxes imposed upon all of the classes of motor vehicles as specified in §§ 32-5-5 to 32-5-46, inclusive, §§ 32-5-77, 32-5-77.3, section 1 of this Act, 32-5B-1, and 32-5B-20 are in lieu of all taxes, general or local, except for the tax created in § 32-5A-1, to which such vehicle would otherwise be subject.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
